Data Access Rights

A taxonomy

Concept Scheme

URI
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights
Publisher(s)
Geological Survey of Queensland
Creator(s)
Geological Survey of Queensland
Created
2019-04-03
Modified
2019-09-10
Source
http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/
Ontology RDF
RDF (turtle)

Description

Data access rights control how users and systems access a data resource.

History Note:

This vocabulary is taken from the COAR Controlled Vocabularies Interest Group (http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/) but is redelivered as that vocabulary isn't well presented online.

Table of Contents

  1. Collections
  2. Concepts
  3. Namespaces
  4. Legend

Overview

 
Figure 1: Taxonomy overview

Collections ↑

  • Closed data access rights
  • Open data access rights

Closed data access rightscl

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/closed-access-rights
Definition Selective restriction of access to data that is OFFICIAL (low or negligible confidentiality impact), SENSITIVE (moderate confidentiality impact) or PROTECTED (high confidentiality impact).
Members http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/protectedcp, http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/restrictedcp, http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/metadata-onlycp, http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/embargoedcp

Open data access rightscl

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/open-access-rights
Definition Data that is non-sensitive, freely available, easily discovered and accessed, and published in ways and with licences that allow easy reuse.
Members http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/opencp

Concepts ↑

  • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/embargoed
  • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/metadata-only
  • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/open
  • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/protected
  • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/restricted
    • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/embargoed
    • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/metadata-only
    • http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/protected

Embargoed accesscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/embargoed
Definition Embargoed access refers to a resource accessible as metadata only until released for open access on a specified date.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/restrictedcp

Metadata only accesscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/metadata-only
Definition Metadata only access refers to a resource in which access is limited to metadata only. Access to the resource requires granting of access rights.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/restrictedcp

Open accesscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/open
Definition Open access refers to a resource that is immediately and permanently online, and free for all on the Web, without financial and technical barriers.

Protected accesscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/protected
Definition Protected access refers to a resource that is stored in a system but is not freely accessible due to specific legal or policy decisions, such as active legal proceedings or ministerial discretion. Access is limited to specific personnel or user groups.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/restrictedcp

Restricted accesscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/restricted
Definition Restricted access refers to a resource that is stored in a system but is not freely accessible. Access is limited to specific personnel or user groups.
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/protectedcp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/metadata-onlycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/data-access-rights/embargoedcp
